ARABIC: وَٱذْكُرِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Remember the Name of your Lord, and devote yourself to Him completely.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But recite the name of your Lord withdrawing yourself from everything, devoting yourself exclusively to Him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with exclusive devotion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Glorify the Name of your Lord, the Lord of the eastern and western regions, with due sincerity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And remember the name of your Lord and, leaving others, devote yourself solely to Him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And remember the Name of your Lord and (Tabattil) devote yourself to Him with complete devotion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with (exclusive) devotion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And remember the Name of thy Lord, and devote thyself unto Him very devoutly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So remember the name of thy Lord and devote thyself with a complete devotion -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Remember the name of your Lord, and devote yourself to Him wholeheartedly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And remember thou the name of thy Lord, and devote thyself to Him with an exclusive devotion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So celebrate the Name of your Lord and dedicate yourself to Him with total dedication.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But keep in remembrance the name of thy Lord and devote thyself to Him whole-heartedly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And remember the Name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with a complete devotion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Remember the Name of your Lord and dedicate yourself devoutly to Him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So remember the Name of your Lord, and devote yourself to Him wholeheartedly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with [complete] devotion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [73:8] And mention the Name of your Lord, that is, say, bi’smi’Llāhi’l-rahmāni’l-rahīm, ‘In the Name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful’, to begin your recitation, and devote yourself [exclusively] to Him with complete devotion (tabtīlan is the verbal noun from batala, used here [instead of tabattulan] in order to concord with the end-rhyme of the verses) for he [the Prophet] is obliged to devote himself to God.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (So remember the name of thy Lord) so pray by the command of your Lord; and it is also said this means: 703 remember your Lord's divine Oneness (and devote thyself with a complete devotion) be completely sincere to Allah in your prayers, supplications and acts of worship.
